channel.title: W3C Web Platform Incubator Community Group-relevant MDN issues
channel.description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by W3C Web Platform Incubator Community Group

item.title: [ecmascript, file-system-access] Wrong description of value that `FileSystemDirectoryHandle.entries()` method returns
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemDirectoryHandle/entries

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

intro, ### Return value

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The entries() method of the FileSystemDirectoryHandle interface returns an array of a given object's own enumerable property [key, value] pairs, in the same order as that provided by a for...in loop (the difference being that a for-in loop enumerates properties in the prototype chain as well).

An array of the given FileSystemDirectoryHandle object's own enumerable property [key, value] pairs.

FileSystemDirectoryHandle.entries() returns a FileSystemDirectoryIterator. It's an iterator, not an array.

What did you expect to see?

An iterator that provides a Promise, which is fulfills with a given object's own enumerable property [key, value] pair

Or something else.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

File System Living Standard — Last Updated 24 July 2023 § 2.4.1. Directory iteration

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response

item.title: [webhid] Confusing phrase "input report" is used for HIDConnectionEvent
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HIDConnectionEvent

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

(the first part), Constructor

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

This article says that this event (HIDConnectionEvent) is create and passed when an input report is received.

However, this event is for connection and disconnection of devices and doesn't look related to input reports (handled with HIDInputReportEvent).

If the "input report" in this article is something different from "input report" haneled with HIDInputReportEvent, it looks confusing to use the same phrase.

What did you expect to see?

Clearer wording without using "input report", if it stands for different thing than "input report" handled with HIDInputReportEvent.
For example, "events are created when devices are connected or disconnected" for the Constructor part.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

No response

Do you have anything more you want to share?

The constructor page
HIDConnectionEvent() - Web APIs | MDN
also uses the phrase "input report" in similar ways in the first part and the Parameters section.
These should also be replaced if they in the main article are replaced.

MDN metadata

Page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/api/hidconnectionevent
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HIDConnectionEvent
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/api/hidconnectionevent/index.md
  • Last commit: 066257c
  • Document last modified: 2022-10-10T08:28:51.000Z

item.title: [file-system-access] `FileSystemHandle.requestPermission()` can throw `SecurityError`
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemHandle/requestPermission

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

Exceptions

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

Only TypeError is listed, but it's possible for requestPermission() to reject with a SecurityError

What did you expect to see?

Mentioning that a SecurityError can be thrown and when.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

Here is a demonstration of a situation where you might get a SecurityError. Click 'pick' to select a file or folder on disk, then click 'request write permission' and wait 6 seconds for the SecurityError to occur.
Source code for this is available here.

Also, here is SecurityError mentioned in the spec.

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response

MDN metadata

Page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/api/filesystemhandle/requestpermission
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemHandle/requestPermission
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/api/filesystemhandle/requestpermission/index.md
  • Last commit: 71e15c4
  • Document last modified: 2022-04-28T06:41:36.000Z

item.title: [html, web-locks] Avoiding duplication/confusion between Location+WorkerLocation and Navigator+WorkerNavigator
item.content:encoded:
mdn/browser-compat-data#9125 is a long discussion about the peculiar cases of Location+WorkerLocation and Navigator+WorkerNavigator, which are the only APIs on the web platform where distinct interfaces are used to represent the "same" thing in window and worker contexts.

For example, navigator.userAgent is available in both window and worker contexts, but navigator itself is a different kind of object. (This difference rarely matters in practice.)

BCD will follow the structure of specs/implementations, but on MDN there's duplication that might be possible to avoid. These pairs of pages and their subpages should be considered for merging or cross-linking:

  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator + https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WorkerNavigator
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Location + https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WorkerLocation

For location it's probably best to keep them separate since the worker variant is read-only. But navigator it's hard to see the usefulness of splits like this:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/languages
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WorkerNavigator/languages
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/locks
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WorkerNavigator/locks

item.title: [entries-api] Issue with "FileSystemFlags.exclusive": does not successfully replace original file
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemFlags/exclusive

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

define dirEntry is type of FileSystemDirectoryEntry;
the condition that is file: exist, when i use

dirEntry.getFile(
  fileName,
  { create: true, exclusive: false },
  (fileEntry) => {
    console.log(fileEntry);
  }
);

i find this condition it cant create new file to cover origin file in this page api introduction;

Specific section or headline?

What did you expect to see?

As the page says，when i use params ,it will cover origin file

Did you test this? If so, how?

MDN Content page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/api/filesystemflags/exclusive
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemFlags/exclusive
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/api/filesystemflags/exclusive/index.html
  • Last commit: f6f11d2
  • Document last modified: 2021-02-19T19:33:30.000Z
